reasoning: Hutchinson-Gilford Progeria Syndrome is an extremely rare genetic disorder with <200 cases worldwide, estimated <0.01 per 100k births. Limited epidemiological data; primarily known from case reports and small cohort studies.
source: Eriksson M et al. (2003). Recurrent de novo point mutations in lamin A cause Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome. Nature. 423(6937):293-298
